revised_title: Hydrocarbon Adsorption and Desorption on Supported Nickel Cracking Catalyst
tldr: This study investigates the adsorption and desorption of various hydrocarbons on a supported nickel cracking catalyst. The research found that all hydrocarbons were strongly bonded to the surface, and the dissociation of some hydrocarbons formed the same surface species. The desorption of hydrocarbons released a significant fraction of their hydrogen when heated in vacuo. The hydrogenation of adsorbed carbon monoxide was also studied, and a reaction mechanism is proposed to explain the observations.
